page.title: 05OLD BROUGHTON MILL
page.content: Broughton Astley Mill is the only mill in Leicestershire still operating on its original site. It was, at first, a windmill that was destroyed by fire which lead to its conversion to a water mill in 1803. Then in 1945 it was converted to electricity by the late L.G.W Pickering. Despite development and modernisation the mill still retains the character of years past. Broughton mill is 150 yards from the stream. Water from the stream fed a canal leading to the mill behind a 6_7 foot dam wall.The stream once powered three other mills before reaching Broughton Mill. Today the mill compounds all types of rations for different animals and also produces a special complete dry dog food,known as Astley Dog.
